step1.sentence: Someone needs to get the ball rolling on the new project before the deadline sneaks up on us.

step2.story: The team had been talking about launching the campaign for weeks without taking action. Finally, Marcus decided to get the ball rolling by drafting the first proposal and sending it to everyone. His initiative broke the deadlock, and within days the whole team was energized and moving forward.

step3.story: Sara had been sitting on her business idea for almost a year, afraid to take the first step. One afternoon, her mentor sat across from her and said, 'You have everything you need — it's time to get the ball rolling.' That evening, Sara registered her company name and opened a business bank account. The simple act of starting unlocked a momentum she hadn't expected. Within a month she had her first paying client, and within three she had a team of four. Looking back, she realized the hardest part was never the work itself — it was simply beginning.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 일이나 과정을 처음으로 시작하거나 첫 번째 행동을 취해 흐름을 만들어 낼 때 사용한다. 주로 주도적으로 일을 개시하는 사람을 묘사할 때 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 볼링이나 크로케 같은 구기 스포츠에서 유래한 표현으로, 공을 굴려야 게임이 시작된다는 데서 비롯되었다. 19세기 후반부터 '일을 시작하다'는 의미로 관용적으로 쓰이기 시작했다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 '시작하다(start)'보다 적극적이고 주도적인 뉘앙스가 강하다. 다른 사람들도 함께 참여하도록 분위기나 흐름을 만들어 준다는 의미가 내포되어 있어, 팀 혹은 집단적 맥락에서 자주 사용된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Let's get the ball rolling with a quick brainstorming session.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 간단한 브레인스토밍 세션으로 일을 시작해 봅시다.
